When the full route opens, up to ten Elizabeth line services an hour will allow passengers from Reading or Heathrow in the West or through the Central London tunnels to Essex and Southeast London. listing.description: Beautifully refurbished with space in mind, originally built in 1923, this fabulous steel hulled Dutch Luxmotor Barge has been painstakingly refitted to be an oasis from city life. Janny has an incredible living space at its core and generous bedrooms. She has a number of original features that give her character and gentle reminders of boat living. That said she is also equipped with central heating, double glazing and a wood-burning stove to shake of any chills. Janny, is situated within short walk to Clapham Junction and close to river taxi stop at Plantation Wharf. In the main area of the house boat is over 1,360 sq. Ft. / 137 sq. M. Of internal accommodation comprising a spacious reception room with double glazed skylights, two double bedrooms, a bespoke kitchen and a modern bathroom. In addition to this living space there is a self-contained annexe with a shower and kitchenette. A further key aspect of this sale is the rare opportunity to own your own residential 40m Thames mooring. Leasehold of 113 years included in sale.

listing.description: This four bedroom semi detached house in Surbiton has been cleverly refurbished making it a beautiful modern family home. As soon as you walk in to the front door you are greeted with stunning decor which gives you just a glimpse of what this property has to offer.One of the main features of this family home is without a doubt the stunning kitchen. Crisp and pristine in design and overlooking the wonderful back garden it is fitted with Bosch and Neff appliances and has the bonus of a separate utility room. Also benefitting from having a separate dining room which has oak wooden flooring and bi-folding doors leading out onto the garden, this part of the house is where all of your socializing, hosting and entertaining will take place.Everything in this property has been done to a high spec and you will not be disappointed as you move on to the other rooms. With brand new carpets throughout, the first floor comprises three of the four bedrooms, a modern fitted family bathroom and huge sash windows which allow plenty of natural light.The third floor is where you will find the best bedroom in the house, a spacious double bedroom which has an amazing en-suite bathroom and a walk in wardrobe both of which have under floor heating. The en-suite has a free standing bath, a shower and two sinks. The walk in wardrobe is bigger than you would imagine and also has another cupboard at the back providing plenty of storage.If you are looking for a property that does not need anything doing to it, this is the home for you! Book your viewing by calling us at Humphrey and Brand, you will not be disappointed.

listing.description: Make a wise move and don't let this Clapham North beauty pass you by. You have bundles of living space, four bedrooms, two well-equipped bathrooms, huge cellar and patio garden with rear access. From here you can sample all the delights of this vibrant area. Clapham and Abbeville Village are each a comfortable stroll as is buzzing Brixton. Transport links are numerous and close by and you've Clapham Common and Brockwell Park in which to chill out.Once the property has entered the first reception on the left features a curved bay window and period fireplace. Next you meet a second reception with rear facing double doors providing garden access and another beautiful fireplace. Walls are a friendly shade of lavender and brilliant white, showing off ceilings and covings throughout. There are wooden floors underfoot waiting to be refurbished and brought to life. Head toward the rear to find a rather sizeable cellar on the lower floor, family bathroom and an enormous kitchen/diner. In here, worktops lay in an l-shaped position along the back and one side of the room so you have plenty of space for a dining table too. You can access the paved garden, which in turn leads to the outbuilding (access via Hetherington Road). On the split level is the first bedroom with windows to the rear and another period fireplace and a wc next door. The first floor as a master bedroom spanning the width of the house and a third bedroom also double in size with fitted wardrobes in the alcoves. A second 2-piece suite bathroom is on the third floor next to the fourth double bedroom. This property requires maintenance to the rear garden access area and boundary wall otherwise offered in the right condition for a personal touch to be added.You just can't lose with this location. It leaves you within a stones throw of Clapham, Abbeville Village and Brixton.The 137 is just around the corner and will whisk you to Sloane Square and Knightsbridge. Clapham North tube is about 5 minute walk for the Northern Line or you've got the Victoria Line in Brixton. Clapham and the ever popular Abbeville Village are but a 10 minute stroll from your front door. Clapham High Street will keep you busy whatever the weather - it'll take you the first three years to sample all their cuisine, and you can walk it off on Clapham Common. In the other direction, Brixton's all a buzz with the newly developed Windrush Square offering a marvellous place to sit, chat and drink coffee. This is before we mention the ocean of funky bars, cafes and restaurants on offer - for some noodles and vino. listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: This stunning four bedroom house was extended and completely refurbished in 2016, and has been maintained by the current owners to an impeccable standard.The ground floor boasts an open plan layout, comprised of a spacious living room, dining area, cloakroom bathroom, and a state of the art kitchen featuring skylights and bi-fold glass doors leading onto the private garden.The first floor features two double bedrooms with wall-length built in wardrobes, a further third bedroom perfect for a nursery or study, and a family bathroom.The second floor consists of a large double bedroom, walk-in wardrobe, wall-length eaves storage, a shower room, and a Juliet balcony.The windows are double glazed and boast premium bespoke shutters fitted by the current owners.Khama Road is a quiet and pretty residential street only a 5 minute walk from the Tooting Broadway underground station (Northern line) and all the amenities of Tooting High Street, including the famous Tooting markets. It is also conveniently located for Earlsfield mainline railway station, and is less than a minute's walk from a bus stop allowing easy access to Wimbledon, Putney, Victoria and beyond. Tooting Leisure Centre and the newly opened gym on Garratt Lane are both a minute's walk away. The home is in close proximity to highly rated primary schools, including Broadwater Primary School, Gatton Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding), and Hillbrook Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding).

listing.description: This 4-bedroom detached family home has been completely modernised to an extremely high standard and is situated within a quiet cul-de-sac. Highlights include a modern kitchen with 'Smeg' appliances, off street parking for several cars, plus a 'tandem' garage.Once inside the property, the entrance hall leads onto the kitchen, two reception rooms and WC. A utility room can also be found on the ground floor. Upstairs the master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and the refurbishment has created 'built-in' wardrobes in three of the bedrooms.This delightful Neo-Georgian style property is situated in the beautiful, historic village of Northaw. The 'Two Brewers' public house is a must, plus the recently opened 'Judges' gastro pub. The Grade II listed church, built in 1881, sits on the edge of the village green as does Northaw Church of England Primary School which was founded in 1879. Nearby, Chancellors Senior School is situated in Brookmans Park and the renowned Dame Alice Owens in Potters Bar. Stormont and Lochinver House Prep schools are also situated in Potters Bar. For the commuter, Potters Bar train station offers a fast service to Kings Cross in approximately 16 minutes.

listing.description: A tastefully refurbished three bedroom mews style townhouse within the heart of Gerrards Cross town centre and railway station.The deceptively spacious accommodation includes a stylishly re-fitted kitchen/breakfast room with an extensive range of high-quality domestic appliances. The drawing room features as its focal point a fire place with fitted living flame gas fire and there is an archway through to separate dining room. Also off the drawing room is a conservatory with electric blinds and doors into the west facing garden. Also on the ground floor is a downstairs cloakroom and access to an integral garage.On the first floor are three good size bedrooms, the master of which features a re-fitted en suite shower room. The family bathroom has also been thoughtfully and tastefully updated.Gerrards Cross 0.1 of a mile, Gerrards Crossstation 0.2 of a mile (London Marylebone22 minutes), Beaconsfield 4.7 miles, CentralLondon 20 miles, M40 (Jct 1) 3.5 miles, LondonHeathrow Airport (Terminal 3) 14 miles.Gerrards Cross frequently appears in surveys of the most desirable places to live in England. Located close to the M25 and the M40, it offers excellent travel links yet retains the atmosphere of an unspoiled, thriving country village. The village’s high street and boutique style shops, cafes, bistros, banks and hotel are mainly on Packhorse Road and Station Road, which together form Gerrards Cross’ bustling heart.Gerrards Cross also has its own ‘Everyman’ cinema in the centre of the village. Just to the south of the village centre is Gerrards Cross Common, an attractive expanse of open grass and woodland with two ponds.Gerrards Cross has an outstanding Church of England primary school and is within catchment for several Bucks grammar schools, while a range of private schools are also available such as St Mary’s, Gayhurst, Maltman’s Green, and Thorpe House.To the front of the property there is a driveway providing parking and access to the integral garage with an electric up and over door, power and light.To the rear is a pretty walled courtyard garden, easy to maintain and features outside lighting, raised flower beds and gated access to the rear.
listing.short_description: A beautifully presented three bedroom mews style townhouse within easy reach of Gerrards Cross town centre and railway station.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionAn immaculately presented three bedroom semi-detached bungalow situated in one of Chigwell's most sought after turnings.This stunning property has undergone full and extensive refurbishment works over the years by the existing owners and is maintained to an immaculate standard throughout.Principle accommodation is arranged over the ground floor and spans in excess of 1600 sq ft which is larger than average for typical bungalow's within the area. Comprising entrance porch, inviting hallway, open-plan dual aspect lounge/ dining area extending beyond 30' leading onto a further family living illuminated with natural light and area overlooking the rear garden. The bespoke fitted kitchen offers a full range of integrated appliances and generous preparation space, off the hallway is the family bathroom room along with three bedrooms including the master bedroom with en-suite shower room. The hidden gem within the property is the newly fitted loft room with handmade fitted cupboards ideal for extra clothing storage, this is accessed via pull down ladder from the hallway.Externally, there is off street parking for three cars and an attached garage and utility room. To the rear of the property there is a well-kept garden which is mainly laid to lawn with plants, shrubs and trees to borders. A decked terrace runs flush off the living space perfect for summer entertaining and al fresco dining.Bracken Drive is one of Chigwell's premier roads and runs just off Stradbroke Drive which contains some magnificent properties. Ideally situated for local amenities including a shopping parade with a good selection of boutique and independent shops, a central line tube station and several pubs and restaurants.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property there are various fees to take into account.

A month's rent will be payable in advance as well as a damages deposit equivalent to a month and a half rent (or 2 months if pets).

Additional fees include a set up fee of £270 incl. VAT; referencing fee of £51 incl. VAT for each tenant and guarantor (if required); plus an inventory check in fee typically £85-£170 depending on the size and type of property.

Once you've found a property you like you need to make an offer, you will be asked for an initial fee of intent to take the property off the market. This is equivalent of half a months rent plus the set up fee. Once references are passed this forms part of your move in money.
listing.description: A stunning, well presented, four double bedroom, Victorian family home located in the sought after Poets area of Wimbledon being close to Garfield School and within easy reach of both Wimbledon Mainline, Thameslink and Northern Line Stations. Having been recently extended and refurbished to a very high standard throughout this wonderful example of a Poets house is a rare find. On the ground floor is a cosy front reception, w/c, dining area which leads down to a fantastic kitchen and a snug with bi-fold doors opening out to a landscaped garden. Upstairs you will find a great children's room, large modern family bathroom and a large bedroom to the front, while stairs lead up to the converted loft offering two further doubles and an en-suite. Houses of this quality are not to be missed so an early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: This charming house is situated on Hale End road which means the walk to Highams Park overground station can be swift and stress free. In the local area there is an abundance of restaurants and bars alongside retails outlets for your day to day convenience. There are three supermarkets within one mile, Tesco, Sainsburys and a Morison. Epping Forest and Highams Park are also within walking distance so bike rides, jogging and seasonal walks can be taken amidst all the different colours that mother nature has to offer. Schools in this area are highly regarded to and the road links offer excellent access to local towns, Westfield in Stratford and also Stansted Airport for international travel. This home presents a family with lots of versatility. The large kitchen/diner to the rear certainly seems as the heart of the home where many a family meal can be cooked and enjoyed, whilst the lounge which stretches from front to back provides all the space you could need for family gatherings or special occasions. The extra room to the ground floor is adjacent to the shower room, so this would really suit an elderly relative or would make a perfect office if you work from home. There are three bedrooms and a family bathroom to the first floor. Throughout this home it feels modern, spacious and bright. Beyond that as soon as you walk through the door there is a fantastic feeling of home. With off road parking to the front means it's easy to get in with your weekly shopping, and there is a pretty and private rear garden with a covered patio providing a perfect space for summer parties and barbecues.What the Owner says:For the past seven years we have really enjoyed this location. There is so much to do in the local area and some beautiful places to explore. There is a dental surgery close by and the doctors surgery is just 0.3 miles away.Since we have been here we have added a new roof, redecorated throughout, replaced the boiler and radiators and also refurbished the bathroom and shower room. The ground floor bedroom and shower room are perfect when we have people to visit and stay, but this also gives options for other uses. We have now decided to move to a different location but this has been a friendly neighbourhood and a happy seven years for us.Room sizes:Ground floorEntrance HallLounge 18'7 x 12'4 (5.67m x 3.76m)Kitchen/Diner 21'8 x 17'9 (6.61m x 5.41m)Shower RoomBedroom 3 13'3 x 8'10 (4.04m x 2.69m)First floorLandingBedroom 1 12'4 x 12'1 (3.76m x 3.69m)Bedroom 2 11'10 x 8'8 (3.61m x 2.64m)Bedroom 4 9'10 x 9'5 (3.00m x 2.87m)BathroomOutsideOff Road Parking To frontRear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: An outstanding four double bedroom, three bathroom semi detached period home, offered for sale in immaculate order throughout having been refurbished at no expense spared by the current owner, who appointed an award winning architect to maximise the full potential of this wonderful home.Situated on one of North Kingston’s frequently requested roads and offering easy access to Richmond Park, the River Thames towpath, local key schools, as well as Kingston and Norbiton train stations and Kingston town centre.The accommodation comprises; a welcoming entrance hall with quality hardwood flooring flowing into both reception rooms. To the front is a charming living room with bay window. To the rear is a dining room with under stairs storage and door leading to the beautifully fitted kitchen with a matching range of hardwood wall and base units, butler sink, contrasting granite work tops and integrated appliances. There is also a modern guest shower room finished to a high standard with marble tiles and chrome finishings.Stairs fitted with oak treads and banisters with bespoke iron spindles lead to the first and second floors and is a feature of this amazing home.There is also a skylight on the second floor landing which allows natural light to flood in.On the first floor there are two double bedrooms both with oak flooring and a gorgeous fully tiled en suite bathroom with bath, WC, sink and bidet, whilst on the second floor there are two further double bedrooms with oak flooring, with one having a modern and luxurious shower room with walk-in shower, WC, sink, bidet and vanitory unit.Viewings are highly recommended for this exceptional property!Pursuant of the Estate Agents Act 1979; we confirm that the seller of this property is an employee of Simpsons Estate Agents Limited, trading as Curchods.

listing.short_description:
A substantial, four bedroom detached residence set in a highly desirable location in the favoured North Ruislip. The property has been meticulously refurbished to a very high standard and offers luxury, unrivalled living beautifully arranged over two floors.

Directions

From leaving our office in Ruislip High Street, proceed left until you reach the mini roundabout and take the second exit on to Eastcote Road. Continue down Eastcote Road for 0.5 miles and the property can be located on the right hand side after shortly after passing North Drive.

Situation

Eastcote Road is within close proximity to Ruislip High Street with its array of shops, cafés, restaurants and transport facilities. Ruislip Tube Station (Metropolitan / Piccadilly line) with links to the City and West End is at the end of the High Street. West Ruislip and Ruislip Gardens (Central / br) stations are also located a short distance away. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away providing access to London and the Home Counties. This house is within walking distance of a number of highly regarded schools including bwi, Bishop Ramsey and Whiteheath. Highgrove Gym and Swimming pool are also a short walk away. Ruislip Manor tube station (Met & Piccadilly line) is less than 10 minutes walking distance via Manor Way.

Description

Presenting this impressive detached residence, set in a highly desirable location in the favoured North Ruislip which has been meticulously refurbished to an extremely high standard throughout. Upon entering the property, you are immediately greeted by a spacious, light-feel and larger than average hallway with tiled flooring and contemporary fire doors providing access to all rooms including a good size separate study/office with ground floor W.C. To the rear, with the continuation of white porcelain tiled flooring, you will find an impressive 19ft open-plan living room overlooking the garden with feature bi-folding doors allowing a mass of natural light to fill the room. The family kitchen is memorable, having being fitted with high quality units, worktops and integrated Neff appliances. The ground floor is completed by a separate dining space with integrated surround sound. Stairs rise to the first floor where there is a landing area providing access to four double bedrooms. The 12ft master bedroom to the rear benefits from having an en-suite bathroom and bespoke fitted wardrobes. Completing the residence is a fully functional family bathroom. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire this wonderful designer haven, flawlessly presented with stylish, high quality features throughout, offered to the market with no upper chain.

Outside

The rear private garden is reasonably sized and mostly laid to lawn with a nice patio area. To the rear of the garden, there is a single garage and allocated space for up to four cars, conveniently accessed from a private side road.

listing.letting_fees:
At The Start Of A Tenancy:

GBP108.00 including VAT per tenant for references

GBP60.00 including VAT for each guarantor if required

The Fee Is For:
Reference applications. These include credit checks, employer references, previous landlord or character references.
Submitting the references to your prospective landlord for approval.
Preparation of the tenancy agreement (including draft agreement) and negotiation of additional clauses.
Preparation of the deed of guarantee if applicable.
General administration.

Inventory Check In:
This fee is available on request and will vary depending on the size of the property and whether the property is furnished or unfurnished. The check in will be carried out by an independent inventory clerk and the fee is only applicable if the landlord opts to have a professional inventory carried out.

During And At The End Of A Tenancy:
The cost to renew the tenancy agreement will be GBP36.00 including VAT. This fee is for negotiating the new term and preparing the renewal document.

The cost to make any amendments to the tenancy agreement during a tenancy will be GBP60.00 including VAT.

At the end of a tenancy the tenant may be required to arrange professional cleaning or pay a check out fee. These fees vary depending on the size of the property and whether it is furnished or unfurnished.

listing.description: SummaryNestled on a quiet road in Barnet is this 4 bedroom completely refurbished semi-detached family home. Consisting of a large open plan reception room, modern fitted kitchen and spacious bedrooms perfect for the growing family looking to be close to High Barnet station (0.7 miles away).DescriptionHigh Barnet is a market town that dates back to the 12th century. Its name is often abbreviated to just Barnet, which is also the name of the borough of which it forms a part. Located in zone 5 on the borders between Whetstone and the Green belt, High Barnet tube station or New Barnet train station offers an easy commute in and out of Central London. Barnet Is considered the perfect location for those who want to be moments away from the countryside, while also being part of London's vibrant city lifestyle.Barnet offers a variety of different styles of architecture, from Victorian and Edwardian properties to modern luxury apartments. There are pockets of large period homes in the wood street conservation area around St John the Baptist Church and overlooking Hadley Common. Parts of Barnet have benefited from modernisation, creating exclusive housing for first time buyers by incorporating the Help to buy scheme on certain units.Between the tree lined roads, Barnet has some fantastic local facilities such as the Old Ford Manor Golf Club, Barnet museum and beautiful open spaces such as King George's Fields and Dyrham Park. Double glazed opaque glass window to side, traditional radiator and ceiling spotlights.

listing.description: Substantial five bedroom detached property with private garden and off street parking, conveniently located close to the centre of Croydon, within easy access of an array of shops and superb transport links. The property does require a programme of refurbishment, but offers enormous scope for customisation and enhancement. Boasting a wealth of original features including high ceilings, large sash windows, ornate ceiling cornicing and central roses, exposed brick walls, feature fireplaces and stripped wood flooring, the property provides impressive, bright and spacious accommodation over three floors as well as a lower cellar level, and huge potential for improvement.Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs down to the cellar, as well as up to the first floor landing, and doors through to the interconnecting lounge and dining rooms with brick surround feature fireplace and attractive bay window to the front aspect lounge, and double doors to the rear onto the garden. From the hallway, a doorway leads through to the ample eat-in kitchen with side aspect window and access to a further utility room with door to the garden. The kitchen itself comprises a range of wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and ample space for appliances. To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms, with bay window and separate dressing room area (with potential as en-suite) to the master, plus a tiled family bathroom with white suite. The second floor provides a further two spacious bedrooms with side aspect windows.Viewings are strongly recommended to fully appreciate the enormous potential, substantial accommodation, and appeal of this property.LocationThe property is conveniently located within a short distance of Waddon station as well as regular bus routes providing useful links into Central Croydon. Croydon itself offers a huge array of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities, as well as mainline stations at East and West Croydon and Tramlink connections to Beckenham and Wimbledon. Purley Way is also close-by for branded shopping, supermarkets, cinema complex and further leisure facilities. With the much anticipated arrival of the new Westfield shopping centre now confirmed for Croydon, the town is only set to improve even further over the next few years.

listing.description: Beautifully presented three double bedroom period Edwardian style property in a popular residential road in the heart of Cricklewood, close to transport links and amenities. The property has been superbly refurbished, with modern and stylish interiors throughout, yet retaining elegant period style in the form of picture rails, cornicing and original fireplace surrounds. The accommodation is bright, spacious and neutrally decorated, with a stunning 'metro-tiled' 20'0 kitchen/diner, two reception rooms, first floor family bathroom, separate WC and downstairs shower room. Further features include gas central heating, inbuilt storage, useful shed/outbuilding, private rear garden and no onward chain. Planning permission has been granted for a rear extension and loft bedroom.Accommodation comprises entrance hall with attractive wood flooring, two separate reception rooms, with original bay to the front room and double doors onto the garden from the rear. The spacious kitchen/diner to the rear enjoys double doors onto the private garden and patio area, and an ultra-modern kitchen area comprising range of matching wall and base units with a stylish 'metro-tiled' splashback incorporating inset sink unit, halogen hob with overhead extractor, electric eye-level double oven, and further integrated appliances. There is also a useful downstairs shower room accessed via the hallway. To the first floor, there are three generous double bedrooms, with dual windows including a bay to the master, plus a sleek family bathroom, again with 'metro-tiling' and white three piece suite, and separate WC.The property is enviably located just a short walk from Cricklewood station providing fast and frequent links into Central London, as well as an array of regular bus routes, shops, bars, restaurants and amenities. The location is also excellent for local schools being just a stone's throw from St Agnes and Child's Hill Primary Schools.Viewings are highly recommended.

listing.description: With cityscape views and much charm and character, this detached 1930's property provides well-proportioned living accommodation over two floors. It retains some period features including picture rails and high ceilings with scope for some updating and refurbishment to enhance this delightful family home and to suit the requirements of a new owner. There is a traditional hall with charming period doors and staircase and good storage. The three reception rooms include a spacious triple aspect sitting room with feature fireplace and an elegant dining room overlooking the garden. The Kitchen is fitted with White Gloss easy wipe units which is continued throughout the Breakfast Room and Utility Room. The Utility Room is a good size with adjacent WC and shower and access to the garage.The first floor accommodation comprises 5 bedrooms (two interconnecting). The master bedroom enjoys far reaching views towards London and is of good proportions with extensive fitted wardrobes. Four of the bedrooms have lovely vistas over the garden and there is a study/bedroom that leads onto bedroom 3 with a basin unit and area with eaves storage. The family bathroom has a roll top bath and basin storage unit and separate WC.SituationLocated in an elevated position on this popular residential road which is convenient for the commuter and with access to local shops in Sanderstead including a Waitrose with more extensive shopping in Purely and the superstores on the Purley Way. The M25 is easily accessible providing access to the national motorway network, Gatwick via the M23 and Heathrow. Nearby are highly recommended independent schools including Whitfgift, Woldingham, Trinity, Croydon High and Royal Russell. Plenty of recreational pursuits are available nearby including a tennis rugby, football and cricket and clubs with golf clubs nearby at Purley Downs and Croham Hurst and access to the spectacular walks on Riddlesdown.Train services: Purley Oaks and Sanderstead Stations (both approx 0.8 miles) have direct train services to London Bridge and VictoriaOutsideThe property is set behind a front garden with hedging and a gently sloping lawn is bordered by a paved drive with flower-bed and panel fencing behind. The paved drive offers ample parking leading to the garage with its internal door to the utility room. The rear garden offers much seclusion and is beautifully landscaped with a patio by the rear elevation with steps leading towards a most attractive circular designed patio area with brick retaining walls and matching steps. There are extensive lawns with ample space for youngster to play bordered by many mature evergreen trees and shrubs leading to a shed at the far end of the garden.

listing.description: Oozing charm and character befitting its era including fireplaces, stripped wooden doors, and sash style windows this wonderful home is one surely not to be missed. Accommodation comprises of an enclosed entrance porch serving a welcoming hallway with ceiling coving, staircase with carved spindle balustrading and ground floor cloakroom. Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

listing.description: This recently refurbished, extended and contemporary four bedroom detached house measures almost 1900sq feet and offers a wonderfully spacious reception room with a dining area, and a stunning hi-spec open-plan kitchen. There is a separate family room which could be closed off if one wished, and a set of bi-folding doors opens onto a pretty rear garden with stone patio area, perfect for alfresco dining and for socialising. Also on the ground floor is a study, guest WC and a utility room which offers garden access. The bedrooms on the upper floor are all a good size, and addition to the smart family bathroom is an ensuite shower room in the master bedroom. The house has been beautifully designed and is very bright and airy with plenty of large windows which flood each room with light, and with plenty of off-street parking it's the ideal home for anyone who loves to entertain and impress.SituationAston Way runs just off Treadwell Road which links Downs Road to Burgh Heath Road in Epsom. The area has a selection of well regarded private and state schools including nearby Epsom College. As well as comprehensive shopping facilities in the town centre, there are numerous leisure facilities, golf clubs and of course the famous Epsom Downs Racecourse within easy reach.4 Bedrooms Reception Room Open-Plan Kitchen Dining Area Family Room Study Bathroom Ensuite Shower Room Guest WC Utility Room Garden Off-Street Parking

listing.description: Guide Price £800,000-£845,000. Set within this sought after gated development is this large and rarely available four/five bedroom, two bathroom, double fronted detached house in an enviable position overlooking the green.Having been refurbished in recent years the property is in excellent decorative with solid oak flooring, double glazed windows and gas fired central heating.The accommodation briefly comprises; a large 16'1 x 10'8 living room with bay window and fireplace and leading to a dining room, a superb modern kitchen breakfast room with granite work surfaces and range style oven and a good size conservatory with hot and cold air conditioning. There is a downstairs cloakroom and the garage has been converted and is currently used as a cinema room but equally could function as a fifth bedroom. Upstairs are four bedrooms; a large master with built in wardrobes and ensuite shower room, a large 19'5 x 9'4 second double bedroom with a secret snug, 0'6 x 9'6 third and a fourth single bedroom. There is also an attractive modern family bathroom.To the rear and with side access is a low maintenance landscaped garden which is perfect for entertaining or an evening meal. There is a large composite deck, patio and shed. Directly opposite the house and with views from the front bedrooms and downstairs reception rooms, is large open green which makes this the ideal spot for families. There is off street parking to the front for two cars.This is a wonderful family home and your immediate viewing is essential. Virtual tours can be seen at Crosier Close is a sought after gated private estate with similar family homes and the use of extensive communal grounds. Both Eltham and Kidbrooke Stations are approximately one mile away and offer regular services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park, Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.
